intro: Mollinedia pallida, commonly known as the pale mollinedia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
